metadata.synopsis: Jake (Eric Stoltz) moves to New York City when he hears that producer Carl Fisher (Tony Curtis) is staging a play he's written. Carl hires starlet Dana Coles (Kathleen Turner) for the lead, but Jake is concerned when she tries to oust his actor friend Chris (Ralph Macchio) from the show. And with his photographer girlfriend, Joanne White (Mary-Louise Parker), warming to art gallery owner Elliot Price (Timothy Dalton), Jake comes to realize how hard it is to juggle art and love.

reviews: Though too imitative of Woody Allen's Annie Hall, Dan Algrant's feature debut is nonetheless well acted by Eric Stoltz, Mary-Louise Parker, Tony Curtis, and Kathleen Turner.
A movie of somewhat indulgent introspection, a confection of twentysomething ambivalence.
A fresh and funny romantic comedy.
What distinguishes Naked in New York is its confidence in its intelligence. It doesn't go for cheap shots or easy laughs, but patiently follows its hero through the labyrinth of his early career.
